ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A further course into learning more characters and grammar structures in Chinese. Learned to speak and write using more complicated and formal language.
I learned a ton about Chinese history and culture within this class.
I improved my reading and writing skills throughout the semester. My grammar also improved a lot with this course.

This course not only greatly increased my speaking, reading, and writing aptitude, but taught me a lot about the different ideologies, traditions, and fundamental beliefs of ancient and modern China. I had to use high level formal Chinese to express my own feelings on these topics, which was incredible practice for both the language and for my own critical thinking abilities.
Overall, I think my depth of Chinese greatly increased, learning more grammar structures, words, etc. I also improved my intuitive thinking of chinese, but a little less so.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: One of the best classes I've had to connect with new Chinese classmates and build bonds outside of my normal friend group. It was an amazing bonding experience and Liu Laoshi is one of the best teachers I've had. The only improvement suggestion I have is to increase the number of debates during class!
Strengths: Liu Lao Shi is an incredible professor who cares deeply for her students. She provided supplementary insights that were interesting and led the class with grace.
This course was very well organized and structured. All feedback was clear and helped improve my personal skills. There were no weaknesses in the class.

Strengths: Really good structure in how it was taught. The textbook does well at building off what we already learned.

Weaknesses: I would have liked to be talking more in the class and practicing my speaking.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, I got to know some amazing students that I never would've had a chance to meet and got to know a wonderful cohort of Chinese classmates.
I recommend this class to any student looking to continue their Chinese education.
Yes its a great course that helped me learn more about Chinese culture and the language. It felt great to have a community of heritage speakers that all eventually became my friends
I would recommend this course to anyone looking to improve their Chinese skills.
I would highly recommend this class to any student wishing to improve their Chinese fluency, as well as better understand themselves, their families, and their unique position as a Chinese American.
Yes, I definitely would. You will not only learn a lot, but also make great friends and build a community of people you feel close to, especially after seeing them every day.
